												Ive played this game on and off since its free to play release and i can say its a good time. if you joyed neverwinter give this a shot, the gameplay is very similar. If you just wanna make your own crazzy ♥♥♥ combination of skills character then this game is for you too. The variety, silly comic book asthetic and momments give this game some life and uniqueness to it. Pros:Unique fun and sillyGame that can bring any crazy ♥♥♥ idea of a super power to life. (mine was a flamboyant dude that killed people with his Ego)good sense of freedom with a decent bit of direction.An assload of powers to chose from and ways to play them. you can do damage with your mind, heal others with your mind, crowdcontrol, tank, displace, all using the mind based tree. so many things you can do with each theme is really awesome.Crazy ♥♥♥ customization, wanna be a power armor wearing super shark from planet go "f*ck your self?" You can!Cons:Runs like ♥♥♥♥, even on powerful computers 6 years after its release you still see choppy frame rates and terrible popin.Even though it says free to play, the best experience with the game is paying the monthly subscription to play a free form character. meaning you can have any powerset any combination with any afinity for damage healing tanking ect ect.PVP is bad, to be expected for a game that allows you to make your own class, PvE is well balanced around it but you wont get far on PVP without some MLG pro build for pwning nooblords. content:
14, 2015
												So, throughout my years (yes years, I had this game with a different account) playing this, I've picked up a lot of good things and a lot of bad things. I'll tell them both and let you decide whether or not you want to play this game. For starters, the pros. -There is a huge community that's kind enough to answer a question you may have or if you just want to make sure. -There's a wide scale of things to do, whether it's leveling your created character or roleplaying with all types of other characters. -The game is pretty big when it comes to customization, you can basically make whatever you want, however you want. -The players who play this are awesome roleplayers, and are great at teaching most how to roleplay or to play in general (Kind of linking to the good community)-Rewards that make you feel like you earn something when you level up, like a great powerful attack or an aura that helps with bleed effect. Now here are some of the cons. -microtransactions, because almost every mmo has them. -Combat is lacking, almost making you snore when fighting this awesome badass alien bug. -Trolls, because every game has them period. -A small percentage (I'm talking like .02%) of the community are just douches to you no matter the reason (linking with the trolls) So really, when it comes down to it, it's a great roleplaying game but it lacks the combat system that games today have, like in the newer Grand Theft Autos or The Elder Scrolls Online, so there are a few give-and-take situations with this. I recommend this game if: -You are an avid roleplayer. -You have a creative imagination when it comes to original characters. -You have patience with few others. -You're into comic-style graphics that look pretty. I DON'T recommend this game if: -You're in it for the combat. -You don't have a sense of creativity. -You have very little patience with anything. -You absolutely HATE microtransactions. There's my thoughts on the game, feel free to let me know if I missed any pros and cons, and try the game out for yourself if you think you're interested.

er 4, 2015
												Alright I first have to praise this game before I have to talk about it's bad parts. The superhero factor of it I really think is brilliant. I'm not saying this as a sarcastic way, but there really aren't a lot of these games around. First off this game is free to play. Good. It is now turning into a bit more pay to play experience which is not great but the game you can still play 100% F2P. Now the controls. The attack functionality is alight, and I'll let it slide. But the movement is kinda weird. Now I've played other MMOS like RIFT, and WoW, and maybe it's just me but it just feels a bit weird. So I'll let it pass. Now to the gameplay side of things. I mean I won't batter this game because I haven't gotten to far. Al far as I can see is it does the missions like any MMO should do. By the way just going to get this out of then way it is much more fun playing these missions with a group or a friend. I almost forgot, one of the hugest things ever in this game is the character customization. Like maybe think of any superhero and you could probably duplicate it. Some people spend hours getting their characters just the way they like it. Another factor is the different type of classes. I both dislike and like how their isn't a lot to choose from or not a lot to choose from. But it makes you less overwhelmed over which class suits you. Like my first time playing WoW I didn't have any idea what to pick. Back to the point, in my opinion the fighting in the game is varied and I enjoy how everyone is a different class or at least looks different. Nobody has to use the same at is and things like that. Which is common in MMOS anyhow. The fighting is enjoyable and pretty fun. Bosses can be hard so when your friend joins along it makes the game more exciting and brings a new taste, to superhero MMOS. Anyhow this is me FunkyPug signing out. P.S. I typed this review on my iPad so any errors or mistakes I apologize greatly.

content:
r 24, 2014
												Champions Online is a broken game. Broken due to long neglect from it's developers, broken due to it's aquesition by Perfect World Entertainment. The game is plagued with bugs (some from beta even), and due to the business practices of PWE, what little content updates it gets are of poor quality. Vehicles, for instance, are simple transform devices that replace your character with a vehicle model and it's appropriate weaponry. However, there's no depth to it. You still play like a character with munitions powers and flight, except now you use a different set of mods. The lastest content, featuring Mechanon, is unforgivably lazy in every aspect. A trend you'll notice in most of the recent updates. In a nutshell, it's the same layout and gameplay with a different tileset texture. Most of the new rewards are in lockboxes, which are opened by keys sold in the cash shop. Gamble boxes with the best stuff that you might sink $50 into and get nothing.However, the core of the game remains, as simple as it may be: Creation. CO has the most versitile character creator out there, and the freedom (for paid players) of power selection makes your character really feel unique. Sadly, there's not much incentive to DO anything with said hero, but it is how it is.The "On Alert" update added a queue system that throws you into with an adhoc team to run a short mission. For many of us, it was the quickest way to level up, as certian alerts grant a large XP reward, as well as a termporary XP boost. That left two zones (Canada and the Desert) completely deserted. (these used to be manditory areas, but you were forced to complete the mission chain before being allowed into the hub zone, so it was changed)The social aspect of CO is very positive. There's never more than a couple hundred people on at any given moment, but those that are tend to be helpful and polite. It's in-game auction house reduces the amount of trade spam, save for people selling keys. Players and Supergroups (guilds) often host costume contests to show off your characters and win prizes. Most everyone is sitting in the hub zone though, and you don't see a lot of player traffic anywhere else in the game.The F2P aspect breathed a lot fo life into the game...for a little while. Many who came have left, and those that remain possess inferior characters (F2P limitations) and thus are more difficult to run with.

												Played this before it came out on steam. This game SUCKS compared to the once beloved City of Heroes/Villains. I will say the bad first in my opinion. -The blocking mechanic seems like the entire game can do without. If you do not block a powerful boss attack, it can completely destroy you, or leave your HP at quite a low level.-The begining missions are so repetative, seeming to take forever due to the fact that with every new character, you HAVE to do them!-Shards. The game's version of servers you can switch through. I would not have a problem with this if they were always available. But it kinda sucks not being able to switch to lets say Millenium City #5 when #5 dont exist anymore due to low players in that zone.-PWE (Perfect World Entertainment).... Yup.Now to the good, which is A LOT!-Character Creation! Clearly one of the most expansive character creators in existance and even surpasses CoX character creator!-Freeform Power System! Although this is not included with the free for all version and requires a monthly subscription to be able to unlock it or a dump of 50$ in the game to permanently unlock a Freeform slot, However, once you can make one, you can mix and match ANY SINGLE POWER YOU WISH! with limmitations on how many powers and such.-Cryptic! Yep, the creators of CoH! Really wish they would stop selling their stuff to sh** companies like NCSoft and PWE. Their games could go to much better companies.-Huge World! Just like in CoH, there are many places to go, rather it be an island with dinosaurs or underwater in the oceon blue, one small thing bad about this is zones x.x-Beautiful Graphics! Yup, no need to say more.All in all, I rate this game a 8/10 and recommend it!

content:
ry 10, 2015
												I started playing this back during it's closed beta. And the game is fun. Logging in now and then is still something I do even after all this time. But it's not a great game. Don't let that make you think it's a bad game though. It had some issues at launch, and the chat window is typically too small. But the combat mechanics are dynamic. For the most part you aren't just standing there and auto attacking. The missions are entertaining too. And yet the game's rather average as an MMO. Which again, isn't exactly a bad thing. There's so many MMOs out there that it can be difficult to stand out from the pack. One fantasy MMO plays remarkably like another fantasy MMO. Sci Fi 3rd person shooter MMOs all play rather similarly too. So this isn't a bad thing in and of it's self. City of Heroes was the first one to feature super heroes. Champions tries to  take a slightly different approach to that clasic but now defunct game. So while this isn't a great game, it's still a good game. And to be honest that's the most you can typically expect from an MMO.The archtypes are interesting, yet in my opinion often underwhelming. They give a good sample of a given framework without giving access to the best abilities in those frameworks. And they shoehorn you into a specific role. Which is fine if that's what you want. But to truely experience the game you want to have access to freeform builds. This is the meat and potatos of character creation after all, and what the game's original claim to fame was. It's where you can pick and chose abilities from any power framework. Want a regenerating dual sword wielder who fires optic blasts and summons robot minions? Go for it. Or maybe it's a psychic sorcerer you want to  build? Again, go for it.While freeform builds are by far the best character builds, they can equally be horrifiyingly bad. Since you can take any power from any framework with few restrictions, it's possible to royally mess up. But again, this is a part of the fun in Champions Online. In short I'd suggest giving the game a shot. And if you do, maybe pay for one month of Gold membership. At the very least you'll have a fun free game to spend time with on occasion. At best you'll fall in love with the game. Me, I fall somewhere in the middle.

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
, 2015
												I been playing this for a while and have to say this is cool.THE GOOD STUFF- Superhero Theme story & play- Cell shading graphics to inforce the Superhero theme- Its not a play-to-win game, paying will make the game easier and give you more options but its not needed. There is loads of ways to customize your hero and a lot to do without paying.- Combat feels a lot more like your in control in later levels attacking is not just pressing one button and watch the action like most MMORPGs (first 5 levels it is one button though)- Good community, its has very low level of toxic and or competitive players, most of them just having fun.- Easy to understand gameplay, no more looking at 100 of stats and managing 50+ different items to make good strategic choices. THE BAD STUFF- The game will have an high difficulty spike in early game, making some people struggle to grind past it, some will suffer from it, some will not.- The game does have some really cool stuff and events locked till you pay, you can play from start to finish, or till you get board, without paying but ya some cool stuff is locked.- The game mechanics can look to simple and be to simple for the die hard "MMORPG MLG PRO" But honestly it can be a very deep and complex game if you look closely. - PVP is almost broken, and there are mix of powers that can make it impossible to get a edge on them.- game tutorial is boaring ......... nuff said!- DLC for the game is to expensive for what it is ......... nuff said!OVERALLIts a very good game for what it was trying to do. Its very easy to get in to and later on if you feel like it you can take the game more seriously and buy DLC for it and look into the deeper parts of combat in the game. It nails the comic book superhero world and feel right with it's cell shading and charicters with there personalities. The combat feels more dynamic and makes you feel more in control in the action and it still keeps the MMORPG feel of combat too. The community is very helpful and layback on the game, it has it toxic moments but all MMORPGs do. Its free to play so there is no real gamble to this game. If it looks good to you, just even a little bit, just give it a try!

content:
, 2015
												Champions Online is set in the world created for the pen and paper game of the same name.  Be warned, the hero creation system is nothing like the Hero system used by the PnP game and free players can only create using Archtypes which determine what powers you can select.  You have to be a subscriber, Life Time member, or purchase a free-form character slot.  Also, there hasn't been any real updates to the game in a couple of years since PWE bought out Cryptic and pulled the major devs off for other projects such as Neverwinter.  But all in all, it's still a fun game with a definite comic book feel to the missions and graphics which was intentional.

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
22, 2015
												Very nice game, delivers what it advertises on the cover.As far as MMOs go this one stays true to the typical grind and craft system where most missions come down to killing 10 of this or collecting 20 of that. However the real fun is in the setting and the way the bigger super villain missions are presented.A lot of the more climactic quests where you finally face of with a super villain is really immersive and well done. You feel like a super hero saving the world from one of it's greatest threats. These are usually instance maps where you don't have to run around with 100 other public players but rather only with your super group.The customizations and costumes are really great and there is a lot of variety and depth. The power system also allows you to create the hero you want, however this is very limited in free to play. The costume slots also allow you to change the look and feel of your hero on the fly and adds to the immersion.When you reach a high enough level, you also unlock the ability to create your own nemesis. This is probably my favourite feature of Champions Online, since you use the same creation toolset used to create your own characters. This allows you to really customize your nemesis and put just as much attention and love into making a nemesis as you do making your hero.The nemesis goes on to generate his own random encounters and missions, where you have to stop him. You really develop a history with the nemesis and look forward to each encounter.I cannot say much about the PvP, since I am not a fan of it in these sort of MMOs. I think unfortunately it suffers from the same problems as other MMO PvP games in terms of meta and conformity.Finally, I do need to add that there is a fairly big gap between free to play and subscription. Although you can get most of the main content and experience on f2p, subscription just opens the game up so much more. You are able to create a freeform character, which means you can choose almost any powers from the power pool (depending on skill trees). The expansion missions that are in included with subscription also add hours of fun.Overall a great game. It has been labelled as dead for quite a few years. But each time I have the money to go back to it, it offers the same level of enjoyment I have grown accustomed to.
